title: Vladimir Petrović-Stergiou
text:
Vladimir "Vlado" Petrović-Stergiou (, ; born January 27, 1977) is a Serbian-Greek former professional <a href="basketball">basketball</a> player. At 6 ft 6 in (1.99 m) tall, he played at the <a href="shooting%20guard">shooting guard</a> and <a href="small%20forward">small forward</a> positions. He is also known as Vlantimir Stergiou, which is his Greek-form name.
Professional career.
Petrović-Stergiou began his career with <a href="KK%20Partizan%20Belgrade">Partizan Belgrade</a> during the 1994–95 season. He moved to <a href="KK%20Borac%20%C4%8Ca%C4%8Dak">Borac Čačak</a> in 1997. He then moved to <a href="KK%20Zorka%20%C5%A0abac">Zorka Šabac</a> for the 1998–99 season. He then joined <a href="Aris%20BC">Aris Thessaloniki</a> in 1999, before moving to <a href="KAO%20Dramas%20BC">KAO Dramas</a> in 2001. He moved on to <a href="C%C3%A1ceres%20CB">Cáceres</a> in 2002, before next joining <a href="Alba%20Berlin">Alba Berlin</a> in 2003.
Petrović-Stergiou next played with <a href="CB%20Breog%C3%A1n">Breogán</a>, whom he joined in 2004. His next playing stop was with <a href="Mens%20Sana%20Basket%20Siena">Montepaschi Siena</a>, whom he moved to in 2005. He then returned to play with <a href="Aris%20BC">Aris</a>, and then next joined <a href="Paris%20Racing%20Basket">Paris Racing Basket</a>. He then played with <a href="Virtus%20Bologna">Virtus Bologna</a>, and then with <a href="KK%20Mega%20Vizura">Mega</a>. After that, his next club was <a href="Anwil%20Wloclawek">Anwil Wloclawek</a>.
Petrović-Stergiou joined <a href="Panellinios%20BC">Panellinios</a> in 2008, and then moved to <a href="Iraklis%20BC">Iraklis</a> in 2009. He then joined <a href="Apollon%20Patras%20BC">Apollon Patras</a>, before finishing his career with <a href="Promitheas%20Patras%20BC">Promitheas Patras</a>.
After one season break from professional basketball, Petrović-Stergiou signed for <a href="G.N.O.%20Aris%20Nikaias">G.N.O. Aris Nikaias</a> in September 2020.
